_comment: State tracking file for archived projects. Projects are moved here from specs/state.json when completed and archived.

archived_projects.summary: Bounded search and axiom matching implemented with depth/visit limits and summary recorded.
Heuristic scoring and branch ordering implemented and summarized.
Caching and context helpers added to ProofSearch with stats and tests.
Temporal swap lemmas proven via Branch B using project 154 artifacts.
Archive examples reviewed; obsolete content removed or relocated.
Context refactor executed per plan with index/README refresh and mapping updates.
Context references remapped post-refactor; plans and summaries updated.
YAML front-matter plan standard change abandoned in favor of marker-aligned format.
Lean routing guardrails implemented with MCP validation and plan updates.
Task status pre-update guardrail implemented for /task.
Command templates and standards unified; docs migrated to YAML/@subagent format.
Research/plan commands now enforce status markers and sync flows.
Branch B executed elsewhere; research line closed as abandoned; artifacts remain in project folder.
Optimized .opencode command routing to delegate to correct subagents with explicit metadata and timing.
Fixed /task status sync failure to ensure atomic updates to TODO.md and linked plan files.
Implemented batch delegation for /task ranged execution with dependency-aware wave scheduling.
Aligned /task with /implement to enforce summary artifact creation for implementation work.
Research completed but implementation abandoned; parser regression deemed low priority.
Improved /add command with better documentation, defaults, and error messages while preserving all features.
Removed dry-run functionality across .opencode commands and agents to simplify execution flows.
Fixed status synchronization across /plan, /research, /revise, /task to ensure atomic TODO/state updates.

Review command-specific status marker implementation for consistency

archived_projects.abandonment_reason: Task superseded by simpler /meta command implementation. The complex system-builder subagents approach is no longer needed.

archived_projects.research_summary: Comprehensive analysis of workflow command status update patterns. Found that researcher subagent correctly implements two-phase status updates (preflight to [RESEARCHING], postflight to [RESEARCHED]). Planner and implementer subagents need verification for preflight status updates. Estimated 6-8 hours to add missing preflight updates and update documentation.
archived_projects.implementation_summary: Added preflight status updates to planner.md and implementer.md subagents, updated command documentation to clarify two-phase status pattern, and created comprehensive command lifecycle documentation. All workflow subagents now follow consistent two-phase pattern.

archived_projects.research_summary: ROOT CAUSE: Line 34 of /implement command missing $ prefix on "arguments". Fixed by changing "from arguments" to "from $ARGUMENTS". Research-001 hypothesis was incorrect - OpenCode DOES pass $ARGUMENTS (proven by /research, /plan, /revise working).
archived_projects.implementation_summary: Fixed typo in /implement command line 34 by adding $ prefix to "arguments". Single line change. Actual effort: 15 minutes. Fix verified by comparing with working commands. No regression.

archived_projects.research_summary: Root cause: subagent specs correct (Task 275 fix), but no enforcement mechanism. Orchestrator validates OUTPUT but not PROCESS. Recommended: extend Stage 4 validation, add stage logging, move status updates to orchestrator.

plan_metadata.revision_reason: Root cause discovered - inconsistent stage naming between planner (step_0_preflight) and researcher (stage_1_preflight)

archived_projects.notes: Research and revision artifact links were NOT automatically added by /research and /revise commands - had to be added manually. /plan command DID work correctly. This demonstrates the exact bug this task is meant to fix.
archived_projects.plan_summary: Revised plan v2: Root cause is naming inconsistency - planner uses step_0_preflight while researcher uses stage_1_preflight, causing Claude to skip preflight. Fix by standardizing to step_N_name pattern. Reduced effort from 6-8h to 3-4h.
archived_projects.implementation_summary: Fixed systematic status synchronization by standardizing stage naming. Changed researcher.md from stage_1_preflight to step_0_preflight. Updated subagent-structure.md to document naming standard. Actual effort: 1 hour.

archived_projects.research_summary: Found that Task 283 successfully fixed general subagents (researcher, planner, implementer) but Lean subagents (lean-research-agent, lean-planner, lean-implementation-agent) still use inconsistent <step_1> naming instead of <step_0_preflight>. This explains Task 259 failure. Recommended extending Task 283 fix to Lean subagents.

Root cause identified: status-sync-manager appends plan links instead of replacing them. Fix requires adding plan link replacement logic with regex pattern matching in step_3_prepare_updates. Estimated effort: 2-3 hours.
archived_projects.abandonment_reason: User requested abandonment. Task is no longer needed.

archived_projects.research_summary: Investigation reveals the issue may already be fixed by Task 281 (added $ARGUMENTS reference to /implement command line 34). Task 259 exists and is valid for implementation. The reported symptom suggests Claude misinterpretation rather than code bug. Recommendation: verify /implement 259 works; if yes, mark Task 292 complete; if no, clarify orchestrator instructions.

archived_projects.description: Refactor the /task command to directly create task entries in TODO.md and state.json without delegating to description-clarifier and task-creator subagents. The command should reformulate the user's rough description into a clear description inline, look up next_project_number from state.json, create the task entry in both files atomically, and increment next_project_number. This simplifies the architecture by removing unnecessary delegation layers while maintaining the same functionality. The command should support the optional flag --divide which creates divides the task into an appropriate number of tasks (between 1-5 tasks). No other flags are needed.

Create a /abandon command that takes a task number as argument (similar to /implement) and updates the status of the task in TODO.md and state.json to [ABANDONED]. The command should validate that the task exists and is not already completed or abandoned, prompt for an abandonment reason if not provided inline, and delegate to status-sync-manager to perform atomic updates to both files. The command should follow the same architectural patterns as /implement, /research, and /plan commands for consistency.

Verify that status-sync-manager has create_task_flow functionality by checking the agent file. Check git history for meta.md and task-creator.md to understand recent changes. This is the first step in investigating unintended changes.

artifacts.summary: Comprehensive investigation report confirming create_task functionality exists

archived_projects.research_summary: Comparative analysis of OpenAgents and ProofChecker systems reveals architectural solution: adopt frontmatter delegation pattern, lazy-loading context index, session-based temporary context, and simplified orchestrator. Eliminates Stage 7 failures by moving workflow ownership from commands to agents. 4-phase migration (56-78 hours) achieves 60-70% systematic improvements.

Root cause: orchestrator does NOT implement Stage 2 (DetermineRouting). Language extraction exists only in documentation. Lean tasks route to default researcher instead of lean-research-agent, causing phantom research. Fix: implement Stage 2 to extract language from TODO.md and route based on command frontmatter. Estimated 5-7 hours.

Comprehensive revision plan to align /meta command with research  plan  implement workflow. Creates tasks with linked artifacts (research reports and implementation plans) instead of directly implementing. Includes task breakdown strategy, artifact structure, and 13-hour implementation estimate.
archived_projects.abandonment_reason: Task has been effectively implemented. The /meta command now creates tasks with plan artifacts instead of directly implementing the system (Stage 7: CreateTasksWithArtifacts). The core functionality described in task 271 is already present in the codebase, making this task redundant.

archived_projects.description: Update `/revise` command to detect plan presence and route to either task-reviser (no plan) or planner (plan exists with report integration).

Remove optimization sections from frontmatter, performance blocks from workflow stages, and verbose comments from all 6 files (todo.md, review.md, reviewer.md, meta.md, task-creator.md, state-lookup.md). Keep state-lookup.md documentation changes.

Fix systematic postflight failures in workflow commands (/research, /plan, /revise, /implement) where artifacts are created successfully but not linked in TODO.md and status is not updated. Root cause: postflight steps (step_4_postflight in researcher, step_7 in planner) are not executing or failing silently. Example: /research 307 created research-001.md but task status remains [NOT STARTED] with no research link. Ensure all workflow commands invoke status-sync-manager in postflight with validated_artifacts array to atomically update status and link artifacts.
Configure opencode agent system to prevent permission interruptions and ensure greater autonomy by relying on git commits for safety while avoiding other backups.

archived_projects.research_summary: Research completed on Task 290. Investigation reveals preflight status updates ARE working correctly (Task 289 fix successful). The actual issue is outdated documentation in lean-research-agent.md requiring summary artifact creation, contradicting standard workflow. Recommended fix: remove summary artifact requirements to match researcher.md behavior. Estimated effort: 2-3 hours.

archived_projects.description: Based on test results from task 304, either keep the core logic changes in meta.md and task-creator.md (if commands work) or revert them to previous versions (if commands fail or create_task doesn't exist). This is a critical decision point.

Refactor the /abandon command to accept a range or list of task numbers (e.g., '293-295, 302, 303') to abandon multiple tasks in a single invocation. This enables efficient bulk abandonment of tasks without requiring multiple command executions.

Fix systematic preflight failures in workflow commands (/research, /plan, /revise, /implement) where status is not updated to in-progress markers ([RESEARCHING], [PLANNING], [REVISING], [IMPLEMENTING]) when starting work. Example: /research 315 does not update status to [RESEARCHING] at start. Ensure all workflow commands invoke status-sync-manager in preflight to atomically update status before delegating to subagents.

artifacts.summary: Comprehensive analysis of preflight status update failures with 7.5 hour fix estimate
Implementation plan with 6 phases focusing on root cause debugging
Revised plan integrating task 320 findings, error logging, and context window hypothesis
Revised plan v3 integrating status-sync-manager bug analysis, eliminating file locking, using git-only rollback, and focusing on timing-aware architecture

archived_projects.description: Fix systematic postflight failures in workflow commands (/research, /plan, /revise, /implement) where artifacts are created successfully but not linked in TODO.md and status is not updated. Root cause: postflight steps (step_4_postflight in researcher, step_7 in planner) are not executing or failing silently. Example: /research 314 created research-001.md but task status remains [NOT STARTED] with no research link. Ensure all workflow commands invoke status-sync-manager in postflight with validated_artifacts array to atomically update status and link artifacts.

artifacts.summary: Comprehensive analysis of postflight failures. Root cause: silent git commit failures, not missing postflight steps.
Analysis of 7 potential bugs in status-sync-manager with 3 critical issues directly causing task 320 symptoms

plan_metadata.revision_reason: Integrated research-004.md findings: researcher.md bypasses status-sync-manager. Fix is straightforward - copy working pattern from planner.md.

archived_projects.description: Conduct a systematic review of the opencode system to complete all aims of the original context refactor plan (.opencode/specs/context-refactor-plan.md) given recent changes. The plan aims to: (1) Eliminate redundancy by consolidating 47 files to 35 files (26% reduction), (2) Document ProofChecker's three-layer delegation architecture, (3) Improve naming consistency, (4) Reorganize context structure (orchestration, formats, standards, workflows, templates, schemas), (5) Update all references across agent/command/context files, (6) Integrate state.json optimization documentation. Review current state against plan objectives, identify completed work, remaining work, and any deviations requiring plan updates.

plan_metadata.revision_reason: Incorporated preflight/postflight workflow context from tasks 320 and 321 to ensure adequate (not excessive) representation of workflow standards in refactored context structure

archived_projects.description: Investigate and prove the root cause of persistent workflow command postflight failures where artifacts are created but TODO.md is not updated with status markers or artifact links. Task 323 provides a concrete test case: /research 323 created research-001.md and updated state.json correctly, but TODO.md still shows [NOT STARTED] with no artifact links. This contradicts task 320 plan (implementation-005.md) which claims task 321 already fixed all critical bugs. Study the workflow execution report, compare expected vs actual behavior, identify the specific failure point in the preflight/postflight process, and prove the root cause with evidence before attempting any solution.

archived_projects.research_summary: Research into OpenCode header and summary display patterns reveals orchestrator already formats prompts as 'Task: {number}' for internal delegation but lacks user-facing headers. Recommended solution: modify orchestrator Stage 5 (PostflightCleanup) to add headers. Estimated effort: 3.5 hours (revised from 4.5 hours - removed summary conclusions as redundant with header).

plan_metadata.revision_reason: Removed summary conclusion formatting (redundant with header display)

archived_projects.description: Enhance the planner subagent to detect new reports created since the last plan version and integrate their findings into plan revisions.
archived_projects.research_summary: Research completed on enhancing planner to detect new reports. Current planner harvests ALL research but cannot distinguish new reports from already-integrated ones. Solution: use filesystem timestamps (mtime) to detect reports created after last plan version. Requires plan_metadata schema extension to track reports_integrated array. 4-phase implementation (4 hours): schema extension, report detection, research harvesting enhancement, postflight integration.

archived_projects.description: Test /task, /meta, and /todo commands to verify they still work correctly after the unintended changes. Document any failures or unexpected behavior. This determines whether to keep or revert core logic changes.

Implement Option 1 (Direct Delegation) from task 309 analysis to optimize /task command performance. Modify /task command Stage 4 to delegate directly to status-sync-manager instead of task-creator, eliminating unnecessary delegation layer and achieving 40-50% performance improvement.

Enhance workflow commands (/research, /plan, /revise, /implement) to update task status at the beginning and end of execution. Commands should set status to '[RESEARCHING]', '[PLANNING]', '[REVISING]', or '[IMPLEMENTING]' at start, report if already in progress, and update to final status ('[RESEARCHED]', '[PLANNED]', '[REVISED]', '[IMPLEMENTED]'/'[BLOCKED]'/'[PARTIAL]') at completion.
